intro: Racosperma heterochroum subsp. robertii, commonly known as the Robert's wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers arranged in spherical heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with compound leaves and distinctive seed pods. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal regions of southern Australia. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and conservation efforts in its native habitat.
